Class Vector2d

  • java.lang.Object
    • Vector2d

  • public class Vector2d
extends java.lang.Object
    A class that contains the individual methods to perform the necessary mathematical functions to return coordinates between two locations

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Vector2d()
      Initial Vector call
      Vector2d(double x, double y)
      Vector2d method to set positions
      Vector2d(Heading a, double dist)
      Vector2d sets polar for a Turtle
      Vector2d(Vector2d v)
      Vector2d method to set positions, internally

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static Vector2d add(Vector2d v, Heading a, double radius)
      Adds a polar coordinate to a vector and returns the resulting position.
      static Vector2d add(Vector2d v1, Vector2d v2)
      Adds two vectors together and returns the resulting vector.
      static double distance(Vector2d v1, Vector2d v2)
      Distance to travel

      Returns the x position

      Returns the y position

      Get the angle component of the vector as polar coordinates.

      Get the length component of the vector as polar coordinates.

      Flips the value entered

      Normalize a vector to length of 1.

      Scales a vector by a given magnitude.
      static double squaredDistance(Vector2d v1, Vector2d v2)
      Finds the squared distance between two vectors.
      double squaredLength()
      Finds the squared length of the vector.
      static Vector2d subtract(Vector2d v1, Vector2d v2)
      Subtracts one vector from the other.
      java.lang.String toString()
      Puts it to a String

      • subtract

        public static Vector2d subtract(Vector2d v1,
                Vector2d v2)
        Subtracts one vector from the other. Note: A good way of thinking of subtraction is: B - A yields A ---> B

        public Heading heading()
        Get the angle component of the vector as polar coordinates. 0 degrees = positive Y

      • scale

        public static Vector2d scale(Vector2d v,
             double scalar)
        Scales a vector by a given magnitude.

      • length

        public double length()
        Get the length component of the vector as polar coordinates. If possible, use squaredLength() instead. This method requires finding the square root, which is slow.

      • squaredLength

        public double squaredLength()
        Finds the squared length of the vector.
